questions.ques: Why so JavaScript and Java have similar name?

options.a: JavaScript is a stripped-down version of Java
options.b: JavaScript's syntax is loosely based on Java's
options.c: They both originated on the island of Java

questions.ques: When a user views a page containing a JavaScript program, which machine actually executes the script?

options.a: The User's machine running a Web browser
options.c: A central machine deep within Netscape's corporate offices

questions.ques: ______ JavaScript is also called client-side JavaScript.
__________ JavaScript is also called server-side JavaScript.
What are variables used for in JavaScript Programs?

options.a: Storing numbers, dates, or other values

questions.ques: _____ JavaScript statements embedded in an HTML page can respond to user events such as mouse-clicks, form input, and page navigation.

What should appear at the very end of your JavaScript?
The <script LANGUAGE="JavaScript">tag
Which of the following can't be done with client-side JavaScript?

options.b: Sending a form's contents by email
options.c: Storing the form's contents to a database file on the server

questions.ques: Which of the following are capabilities of functions in JavaScript?

options.b: Accept parameters and Return a value

questions.ques: Which of the following is not a valid JavaScript variable name?

How does JavaScript store dates in a date object?

options.a: The number of milliseconds since January 1st, 1970
options.b: The number of days since January 1st, 1900
options.c: The number of seconds since Netscape's public stock offering.
